commit.title: gitlab: don't run azure tests on Fedora
commit.message:
gitlab: don't run azure tests on Fedora

The Azure tests (and cloud tests in general) run the cloud image
validator, which is specifically tailored to validate RHEL cloud images.
Currently, it's failing because of a recent change that checks for
kernel command line arguments that aren't used in the Fedora images [1].

We could revert the change, or make exceptions for Fedora, but I'd
rather we remove these tests here for a few reasons:
- We already boot Fedora images in the osbuild/images CI and run some
  basic checks on them.
- Our Fedora images aren't official, so there is no requirement that we
  follow specific guidelines for their configuration, which would need
  to be codified into and verified by CIV.
- Reducing the test surface of osbuild-composer's CI is something we
  want to do in general as we move such testing to osbuild/images.

[1] https://github.com/osbuild/cloud-image-val/commit/81bedbb1884b63b529efb2cbd1475680d85ccb41

- Reducing the test surface of osbuild-composer's CI is something we
  want to do in general as we move such testing to osbuild/images.

[1] https://github.com/osbuild/cloud-image-val/commit/81bedbb1884b63b529efb2cbd1475680d85ccb41

commit.title: gitlab: don't run azure tests on Fedora
commit.message:
gitlab: don't run azure tests on Fedora

The Azure tests (and cloud tests in general) run the cloud image
validator, which is specifically tailored to validate RHEL cloud images.
Currently, it's failing because of a recent change that checks for
kernel command line arguments that aren't used in the Fedora images [1].

We could revert the change, or make exceptions for Fedora, but I'd
rather we remove these tests here for a few reasons:
- We already boot Fedora images in the osbuild/images CI and run some
  basic checks on them.
- Our Fedora images aren't official, so there is no requirement that we
  follow specific guidelines for their configuration, which would need
  to be codified into and verified by CIV.
- Reducing the test surface of osbuild-composer's CI is something we
  want to do in general as we move such testing to osbuild/images.

[1] https://github.com/osbuild/cloud-image-val/commit/81bedbb1884b63b529efb2cbd1475680d85ccb41

commit.title: Many: don't use rpmmd.PackageSpec in Weldr API and store
commit.message:
Many: don't use rpmmd.PackageSpec in Weldr API and store

Add a new struct `weldrtypes.DepsolvedPackageInfo` to represent
depsolved package set in Weldr API endpoints and in the Weldr store.
This will make it possible to rework `rpmmd.PackageSpec` in
osbuild/images, without breaking Weldr API or its store.

Signed-off-by: Tomáš Hozza <thozza@redhat.com>

commit.title: Many: don't use rpmmd.PackageSpec in Weldr API and store
commit.message:
Many: don't use rpmmd.PackageSpec in Weldr API and store

Add a new struct `weldrtypes.DepsolvedPackageInfo` to represent
depsolved package set in Weldr API endpoints and in the Weldr store.
This will make it possible to rework `rpmmd.PackageSpec` in
osbuild/images, without breaking Weldr API or its store.

Signed-off-by: Tomáš Hozza <thozza@redhat.com>
